definition: to be unable to tolerate or endure/to find sth difficult to manage
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
(negative prefix)/not/no
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: It was too hot even for a gentle stroll.
sentences.chinese: 天太热，连慢慢散步都吃不消。

sentences.english: Their overbearing bureaucracy and their self-satisfied airs are really more than one can stand.
sentences.chinese: 他们那种神气十足的官僚架子实在叫人吃不消。

sentences.english: All of this stuff can feel a bit overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些东西会让你感觉到吃不消。

sentences.english: If it gets to be too much for you, you`ll just stay home again.
sentences.chinese: 如果你吃不消，你就再在家呆着修养。

sentences.english: Too much repetition is hard on the mind.
sentences.chinese: 太多的重复在心理上或吃不消。

sentences.english: This is just too much. Now I have to drive to Tainan tonight for business.
sentences.chinese: 真让人吃不消，我现在得连夜开车下台南出差。

definition: unbearable/unable to endure/can't stand
to be unable to bear or support
to be able to endure (exertion, fatigue etc)/to be able to afford
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
tired/exhausted
to be unable to endure
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: unbearable/terrible/enough/unlikely
to become exhausted
to complain without stopping (idiom); to bitch endlessly/incessant grievances
to feel numb
(coll.) unable to withstand/cannot bear/can't stand it/no match for
physically and emotionally exhausted
to feel terrified/to grow apprehensive
